page.title: 05Hobbies in Ousden
page.content: As almost everyone has a garden, gardening is by far the most popular hobby. Although some people grow vegetables it is the flowers and shrubs which abound, and the whole village is a blaze of colour during the summer months, even to small patches on the side of fields. All the homecraft subjects such as knitting, embroidery, dressmaking and cookery are well practiced followed by reading, writing, music, painting, bridge & whist. Others make a hobby of renovating their homes or doing woodwork, and making models. Outside the home, people of varying ages enjoy sports such as swimming, badminton, golf, dancing, snooker, shooting, fishing, pigeon racing, motorcycle scrambling, roller skating and showing horses. Some of the ladies make the Womens' Institute their hobby.
